t: Psalm 80
For the director of music. To the tune of “The Lilies of the Covenant.” Of Asaph. A psalm.
Hear*pn us, Shepherd of Israel, you*ld who lead Joseph like a flock. You*ln who sit enthroned between the cherubim, shine*ld forth
before Ephraim, Benjamin and Manasseh. Awaken*ln your might; come*ld and save us.
Restore*pn us, O God; make*ld your face shine on us, that*ld we may be saved.
How*pn long, Lord*s God Almighty, will*ld your anger smolder against*ld the prayers of your people?
You*ln have fed them with the bread of tears; you*ld have made them drink tears by the bowlful.
You*ln have made us an object of derision to our neighbors, and*ld our enemies mock us.
Restore*pn us, God Almighty; make*ld your face shine on us, that*ld we may be saved.
You*pn transplanted a vine from Egypt; you*ld drove out the nations and planted it.
You*ln cleared the ground for it, and*ld it took root and filled the land.
The*ln mountains were covered with its shade, the*ld mighty cedars with its branches.
Its*ln branches reached as far as the Sea, its*ld shoots as far as the River.
Why*pn have you broken down its walls so*ld that all who pass by pick its grapes?
Boars*ln from the forest ravage it, and*ld insects from the fields feed on it.
Return*ln to us, God Almighty! Look*ld down from heaven and see! Watch*ln over this vine,
the*ld root your right hand has planted, the*ld son you have raised up for yourself.
Your*pn vine is cut down, it is burned with fire; at*ld your rebuke your people perish.
Let*ln your hand rest on the man at your right hand, the*ld son of man you have raised up for yourself.
Then*ln we will not turn away from you; revive*ld us, and we will call on your name.
Restore*pn us, Lord*s God Almighty; make*ld your face shine on us, that*ld we may be saved.
